reviewText: Shows in black and white, don't like.

Herbert L. Maris (1880-1960) was a Philly corporate lawyer who lent his name and case files to the TV series LOCK UP. Macdonald Carey portrayed Maris on this half-hour show, with John Doucette playing his detective pal, Lt. Weston. LOCK UP had a 78 episode, two season run from 9/26/59 to 6/17/61. It's interesting to see a mix of up and coming actors and former stars still keeping busy. For example, the very last broadcast, "The Case of Nan Havens," has Mary Tyler Moore in the title role but she's third billed on the "also" list. Jackie Coogan, who found childhood fame in Charlie Chaplin's THE KID (1921), is just another name in the beach-based chapter entitled "Society Doctor." (Coogan's career would soon revive as THE ADDAMS FAMILY's Uncle Fester. Here in "The Seventh Hour," Robert Armstrong, star of KING KONG (1933) is featured, while Patty Duke's TV dad (William Schallert) is seen in "Compulsive Killer." Thanks to fine scripts and acting, these shows are all above average in quality. Definitely recommended. . Contents of COPS VOL. 3 - "Lock Up" (Includes episode numbers, original airdates and guest stars.) THE SEVENTH HOUR (#47 - 11/5/60) - Robert Armstrong/Lori Nelson/Len Lesser/Robert Bice/Frank Gerstle/Frank Puglia NUMBER PLEASE (#51 - 12/3/60) - John Litel/James Bronte/Arline Hunter/Charles Fredericks/Louise Lorimer/John Hackett DIAMOND DUPE (#48 - 11/12/60) - Frank Jenks/Paula Raymond/Tyler McVey/Steve Drexel/Harry Tyler COMPULSIVE KILLER (#54 - 12/24/60) - William Schallert/Patricia Medina/Barbara Hines/John Rockwell/Ralph Reed GIRLS WANTED (#55 - 12/31/60) - Barbara Luna/Olive Carey/Kasey Rogers/Lenny Kent
